availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James S. Wallace (Louisville, Kentucky, newspaper editor and theatre manager)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, newspaper editor and theatre manager. New York native. Married to Eliza Wallace in Washington, District of Columbia, in 1840. Father of Charlotte Wallace, Cath Wallace, James Wallace, Nina Wallace, and Henry Wallace. Producer and manager for several stage dramas, in Boston, Massachusetts, and New York, New York, including "Westward, Ho!" and "Spy at Washington," in the 1830s. Newspaper editor at the Philadelphia Gazette and the Philadelphia North American in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Editor at the Pennsylvania Miner's Journal in Pottsville, Pennsylvania, in 1838. Editor at the Harrisburg Telegraph in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania, in 1840. Editor at the Philadelphia Forum in Philadelphia in 1842. Agent for the Associated Press. Manager of the Louisville Theater in Louisville in 1858. Assistant Editor at the Louisville Journal from 1860 to 1865. Died in Louisville in February 1865.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward No. 3, p. 122. “A National Loss,” The Louisville Daily Journal (Louisville, Ky.), February 20, 1865, p. 2. "The Late James S. Wallace," The Louisville Daily Journal (Louisville, Ky.), February 28, 1865, p. 1. James Rees, The Dramatic Authors of America (Philadelphia: G. B. Zieber & Co, 1845), 139.
